Finally. The position has reached the kind of a King's Indian setup that offers good attacking possibilities for both sides. At this point, White has achieved a very menacing position due to his undisputed control of the center.
Black quitely continues with his development unmindful of White's dominating center.
A very aggressive move and starting to exert his influence on the king's position.

Black made this move in the hope that if White exchanged Bishops with 12. Bxg4, he would weakened the white squares on White's position.
Preparing to castle kingside with 13. O-O thereby bringing the King to safety.
Black is slowly gaining control of the dark squares. Notice the position of the bishop on c1 that made the whole thing possible.

And now, it is Black who suddenly becomes aggressive due to the fact that his pieces are better placed than the White's counterparts. Notice his total control of the dark squares at the moment.
